author: VNExplorer
title: Momentos de horror: en video quedó registrado el voraz incendio que consumió gran parte de uno los hospitales más importantes de Irán
text:
A esta hora se produce un incendio en el hospital Gandhi de Teherán, según fuentes de los medios iraníes. El portavoz del departamento de bomberos del municipio de Teherán, Seyyed Jalal Maleki, anunció un incendio en el hospital Gandhi en la calle Waliasr.
La operación de extinción del incendio está en marcha. La causa del incidente está bajo investigación y se desconoce el número de posibles víctimas.
Según información del sitio web del Hospital Gandhi, este complejo cuenta con 100 camas, 17 quirófanos y 100 suites residenciales. Sin embargo, no se ha publicado información sobre el número de pacientes y otras personas que se encontraban dentro del hospital en el momento del incendio.
Pedram Pak-Ayin, portavoz del Ministerio de Salud, dijo que “ninguno” de los trabajadores y pacientes del Hospital Gandhi ha resultado herido. Agregó que la causa del incendio no está clara y agregó: “Los pacientes del Hospital Gandhi están siendo trasladados a otros centros médicos”.
Agregó que la causa del incendio no está clara y agregó: “Los pacientes del Hospital Gandhi están siendo trasladados a otros centros médicos”.
Otro caso de incendio Al menos cuatro presos murieron en el 2022 y otros 61 resultaron heridos después de que se produjera un incendio en la prisión de Evin de Teherán durante la noche tras una pelea entre reclusos, según informó la agencia oficial de noticias estatal IRNA citando al poder judicial del país.
La Justicia de Irán imputó a 40 personas en relación con ese incendio registrado en otoño de 2022 en al cárcel de Evin, en Teherán, la capital del país, que se saldó con la muerte de ocho presos y varios heridos. Así lo ha confirmado el fiscal general, Alí Salehi, que ha recalcado que todos ellos han sido citados para declarar ante el juez, según informaciones de la agencia de noticias iraní Mehr.
El incendio tuvo lugar hace ahora un año en plena protestas contra el Gobierno, si bien no se ha logrado establecer las causas del mismo. La Fiscalía insiste en desvincular el incendio de las manifestaciones y ha citado “conflictos internos” como principal hipótesis.
La prisión de Evin, situada en el norte de Teherán, es conocida por albergar a presos políticos, quienes han denunciado ser víctimas de tortura y malos tratos. Los manifestantes detenidos entonces también fueron encarcelados en esta prisión.
El incendio dejó varias casas reducidas a cenizas (imagen de referencia)
Tragedia tras incendio en fiesta de cumpleaños en Irán Ocho personas, incluyendo cuatro niños, murieron en un incendio mientras celebraban un cumpleaños en un restaurante en las afueras de la capital de Irán, Teherán, informó el miércoles un medio estatal.
El incendio comenzó el martes en la tarde en un restaurante subterráneo en la localidad de Andisheh, al sur de Teherán, durante una fiesta de cumpleaños, informó la agencia de prensa oficial IRNA.
“Siete personas murieron en el lugar y un niño de tres años falleció en el hospital”, indicó Shahin Fathi, director de la Media Luna Roja de la provincia de Teherán.
El fiscal encargado del caso, Hamid Asgari, indicó que el incendio se propagó rápidamente por todo el establecimiento.

author: The Ridgway Record
title: Unlocking Full Spectrum Wellness with EMR TEK's Krypton UV | User | ridgwayrecord.com
text:
In a country where winter months can dim more than just the daylight, the Krypton UV arrives as a powerful ally in supporting year-round wellness. EMR-TEK, the Canadian brand already known for its innovation in red light therapy, has introduced a new kind of full-spectrum solution: one that includes the often-overlooked potential of UV light therapy.
With the launch of the Krypton UV, EMR-TEK is inviting Canadians to experience wellness support through carefully engineered light exposure that fits seamlessly into any lifestyle.
What Sets Krypton UV Apart?Full-Spectrum LED Power
This device blends powerful wavelengths for a comprehensive at-home light therapy experience:
-
606W LED Power delivers high-intensity red and near-infrared light (630nm, 660nm, 810nm, 830nm)
-
Premium Philips UV Bulbs emit UVA and UVB light with therapeutic-grade precision
-
FDA-Approved UV Bulbs offer peace of mind for wellness-conscious users
Each wavelength is selected to support natural processes—helping users enhance their daily routine, recovery, and energy.
Designed for Durability and Comfort
-
3mm Tempered Glass Protection reduces the risk of injury
-
Electronic Ballasts ensure flicker-free lighting for a smooth, comfortable experience
-
PRO Series Electrical Upgrades deliver reliable, high-performance operation
The Krypton UV is more than a device—it’s a long-term investment in self-care that delivers professional-grade results at home.
Why Canadians Are Turning to UV Light TherapyThe Rise of UVA and UVB in Daily Wellness
While red light has dominated the wellness conversation, UVA light therapy and UVB are gaining attention for their supportive roles in:
-
Skin wellness
-
Seasonal mood enhancement
-
Daily rhythm and energy optimization
As Canadian winters bring extended darkness, interest in light-based solutions that mimic natural sunlight has surged.
Who Is It For?
Whether you're a seasoned biohacker or just exploring light therapy, the Krypton UV is made for:
-
Biohackers seeking full-spectrum optimization
-
Wellness explorers building holistic routines
-
Busy professionals who want a convenient, effective tool
Built to Fit Real LivesCompact Power
This device doesn’t compromise on strength, despite its manageable size:
-
Dimensions: 1.96 x 1.44 x 0.24 ft
-
Compact enough for home, powerful enough for clinics
-
Easy Bulb Replacement with detachable Philips bulbs
Aesthetic Meets Function
The sleek design of the Krypton UV ensures it fits naturally into any modern space—proving wellness devices can be both functional and beautiful.
Powered by Purpose: The EMR-TEK StoryA Founder’s Vision
Kris, EMR-TEK’s founder, didn’t enter the light therapy world by chance. Diagnosed with vitiligo at an early age, he turned to UVB sessions for relief and recovery. This personal experience inspired a passion for accessible, high-performance wellness tech.
Continuing the Mission
The Krypton UV is the next step in EMR-TEK’s journey, continuing its legacy of:
-
High-quality, research-driven design
-
Precision-engineered wavelength delivery
-
Affordable innovation that doesn’t compromise on quality
A Brighter Wellness Future
With the Krypton UV, EMR-TEK is once again setting a new standard in light therapy innovation. This is more than a device—it’s a signal of where wellness is headed.
Whether you're optimizing performance, maintaining balance during the winter, or simply adding intentionality to your self-care routine, EMR-TEK's UV light therapy solutions are ready to support your goals.
Discover More:
-
Learn about UVA light therapy and how it supports everyday wellness
-
Explore EMR-TEK’s full UV light therapy product lineup
-
Dive deeper into the benefits of red light therapy for your routine
Media Contact
Company Name: EMR-TEK
Contact Person: Eli Halliday
Email: Send Email
Country: Canada
Website: https://emr-tek.com/collections/uv

author: Abhimanyu Kulkarni
title: As Warfare Moves Into Newer Battlefields, Army Chief Manoj Pande Explains India Plan
text: Making a push for self-reliance, Army Chief General Manoj Pande said that unprecedented changes are taking place in the geopolitical landscape and the country's defence will have to keep evolving to keep up with the changing battle space. At NDTV's maiden Defence Summit, General Pande said that non-state actors are "increasingly gaining access" to modern military technologies.This trend, he explained, has led to a rise in risk-taking behavior and a lower threshold for the initiation of armed conflicts."The fallout is an increased propensity in risk-taking behavior and low threshold for initiation of armed conflicts," General Pande stated, acknowledging the challenges posed by the changing dynamics in modern warfare."Amidst all of above, the legacy challenges of unsettled borders continue. Newer threats in the conflict spectrum have added to the complexities," he said.The Army chief said that "grey zone actions and aggression by our adversaries is manifesting across multiple domains including the military i.e. on land, air and maritime space".Consequent to all these developments, the battle space has become more "complex, contested and lethal and shall remain so in the future", General Pande said.He highlighted how warfare has diversified into new domains, including cyber, electromagnetic spectrum, information, and space. General Pande said that the Indian Army is working on adapting to maintain a competitive edge as battlegrounds undergo a paradigm shift in modern warfare."Amidst this complicated canvas that I just described, our nation continues to rise. As a nation, we have envisioned, and taken up the resolve to emerge as a developed nation when we celebrate our centenary milestone," he said.India has set the vision of becoming a developed a nation by 2047 when it completes 100 years since independence."The aspirations of rising India shall span across expanding strategic horizons. The foremost implications for us therefore is to ensure that the nation's security is not impacted in any way so that the progress continues unabated," General Pande said.PromotedListen to the latest songs, only on JioSaavn.com"We are working on 45 niche technologies and 120 indigenous projects which have implications for the military. The Indian Army's vision is to transform into a modern, agile, adaptive, technology enabled, future-ready force capable to deter and win wars in a multi-domain operational environment to protect our national interest," he said.Track Latest News Live on NDTV.com and get news updates from India and around the world. Watch Live News:Follow Us:Manoj PandeIndian Armymodern warfare

author: Sarah Medina
title: The First Carbon-Positive Hotel in the U.S. Is Extremely Trippy Inside
text:
The First Carbon-Positive Hotel in the U.S. Is Extremely Trippy Inside
The architecture is meant to resemble Colorado's famous Aspen trees.
With
sustainable travel on the rise, eco-conscious hotels across the world boast compostable packaging, reduced-water laundry practices, and indoor-outdoor architecture to lure in climate-minded travelers. But the new Populus hotel in Denver might be the first one to actually try and be a tree.
The first carbon-positive hotel in the United States, which opens in downtown Denver this summer, Populus takes sustainable travel to the next level: In addition to using low-carbon concrete mixes, high-recycled materials, and more during construction, the hotel is offsetting its long-term carbon footprint by planting trees across Gunnison County, Colorado. Already, more than 70,000 Engelmann Spruce trees, a plant native to the area that has been threatened by beetles, have been planted. Together, the trees will sequester more carbon than the building can emit in its life. Guests can even visit the newly planted forest themselves, just put the coordinates 38°03'59.4 "N 106°55'24.6 "W in a GPS.
But what might be most striking about the new-build hotel is the facade, which was inspired by Colorado’s famous Aspen trees. Designed by Studio Gang, the same firm that brought you the wavy Aqua Tower in Chicago and the twisting MIRA tower in San Francisco, the white exterior of the hotel is covered in what appear to be porous openings, but are actually just windows. The hotel’s distinctive windows pull double duty: They are meant to mirror the characteristic patterns of Aspen trees, while offering shade and boosting efficiency.
The nature-inspired design follows to the hotel's 265 rooms and multiple restaurants and common spaces that are outfitted in neutral tones, from sand to terra cotta, and filled with natural materials—reclaimed fencing wood from Wyoming and "leather" tapestries made from mushrooms.
Both of the hotel's restaurants will minimize their waste and work closely with regenerative farmers in the area to offer seasonal dishes. The rooftop bar in particular, Stellar Jay, offers live-fire cooking and wild game as well as stunning views of the Rocky Mountains.
Ready to go? Reservations can be booked at
populusdenver.com.

author: Spencer Heath
title: Child shot in head during road rage incident
text: Investigators said a child ended up being shot in the head, and another person was shot in the chest. They were transported to a hospital in stable condition. Anyone with information is encouraged to reach out to the Capital Area Crime Stoppers Program by visiting Austin Crime Stoppers or calling 512-472-8477.
